citeinfo.origin: Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: The Ocean Environment

abstract.p: A brief historical background of ocean explorations and some dominant, as well as, some unique aspects of the overall environment are presented as background for subsequent discussions of specific fisheries. The distressingly slow accumulation of environmental knowledge, the extensive contributions made by fisheries oceanography programs, and the need for expanded, coordinated, interdisciplinary studies involving the participation of all research vessels including those of the commercial fishing fleets is stressed.

[Reference: Favorite, F., W.J. Ingraham, W.B. McAlister, G.A. Sanger, and S.E.K. Turner. The Ocean Environment. Northwest Fisheries Center Process Report. 1976. 87 p.] Available at the NOAA Libraries.

descript.purpose: To describe the ocean environment and its life, forms, behavior and origins.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
